metadata.title: CVE-2024-27851 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS for NVIDIA BlueField (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
The issue was addressed with improved bounds checks. This issue is fixed intvOS 17.5, visionOS 1.2, Safari 17.5, iOS 17.5 and iPadOS 17.5, watchOS10.5, macOS Sonoma 14.5. Processing maliciously crafted web content maylead to arbitrary code execution.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-27851` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.1 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-6.0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit-6.0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.1 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libjavascriptcoregtk-6.0-1 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkit2gtk-4.1-0 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
libwebkitgtk-6.0-4 - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.44.3-0ubuntu0.22.04.1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit package in jammy is affected and may need fixing.
